Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import time import os from urllib.parse import quote, unquote import re print("=== FINAL CORRECTED VERIFICATION: FIXING VARIABLE SCOPING ERROR ===\n") print("Objective: Complete the verification analysis with proper variable scoping\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Analyze the existing history file with corrected logic print("=== ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH CORRECTED LOGIC ===\n") history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'history_page_raw.html') if os.path.exists(history_file): print(f"Analyzing history file: {os.path.basename(history_file)}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(history_file):,} bytes") with open(history_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: history_content = f.read() history_soup = BeautifulSoup(history_content, 'html.parser') # Extract revision entries systematically print("\nExtracting revision entries with systematic approach...") all_lis = history_soup.find_all('li') revision_entries = [] for i, li in enumerate(all_lis): li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_html = str(li) # Check if this list item contains revision-like content has_diff = 'diff' in li_html.lower() or 'hist' in li_html.lower() has_date = re.search(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', li_text) has_user = 'talk' in li_text.lower() or 'contribs' in li_text.lower() or 'user:' in li_text.lower() if (has_diff or has_date or has_user) and len(li_text) > 20: # Extract dates from this entry date_patterns = [ r'(\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})', # 12:34, 5 June 2023 r'(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})', # 2023-06-05 r'(\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4})', # June 5, 2023 r'(\d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})' # 5 June 2023 ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, li_text) found_dates.extend(matches) revision_entries.append({ 'index': i, 'text': li_text[:300], # First 300 chars 'dates': found_dates, 'has_diff': has_diff, 'has_user': has_user, 'full_text': li_text }) print(f"Found {len(revision_entries)} potential revision entries") # Extract all dates and analyze them properly all_dates_found = [] for entry in revision_entries: all_dates_found.extend(entry['dates']) if all_dates_found: unique_dates = sorted(set(all_dates_found)) print(f"\n=== DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print(f"Total unique dates found: {len(unique_dates)}") # Show first 10 and last 10 dates print(f"\nFirst 10 dates: {unique_dates[:10]}") if len(unique_dates) > 10: print(f"Last 10 dates: {unique_dates[-10:]}") # Fixed: Properly scope the date_str variable pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] current_year = datetime.now().year for date_entry in unique_dates: # Fixed variable name # Check for dates before June 2023 if any(year in date_entry for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_entry) elif '2023' in date_entry: early_2023_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'jan', 'feb', 'mar', 'apr'] if any(month in date_entry.lower() for month in early_2023_months): pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_entry) # Check for impossible future dates if any(str(year) in date_entry for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): future_dates.append(date_entry) print(f"\nDates before June 2023: {len(pre_june_2023_dates)}") if pre_june_2023_dates: print("Pre-June 2023 dates found:") for date in pre_june_2023_dates: print(f" - {date}") print(f"\nFuture dates (data quality issues): {len(future_dates)}") if future_dates: print("‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: Found impossible future dates:") for date in future_dates[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {date}") if len(future_dates) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(future_dates) - 10} more") print("This indicates test/sandbox content or data corruption") else: print("\n‚ùå No dates found in revision entries") unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] else: print(f"‚ùå History file not found: {history_file}") revision_entries = [] unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] # Access fresh Wikipedia data for comparison print("\n=== ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION ===\n") page_title = "Antidisestablishmentarianism" history_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=history" headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Accessing fresh history page: {history_url}") try: fresh_response = requests.get(history_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if fresh_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page") print(f"Content length: {len(fresh_response.content):,} bytes") # Save fresh history for comparison fresh_history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_history_fresh.html') with open(fresh_history_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(fresh_response.text) # Quick analysis of fresh data fresh_soup = BeautifulSoup(fresh_response.content, 'html.parser') fresh_text = fresh_soup.get_text() # Look for dates in fresh content fresh_dates = re.findall(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', fresh_text) fresh_unique_dates = sorted(set(fresh_dates)) print(f"\nFresh data analysis:") print(f" Total dates found: {len(fresh_unique_dates)}") if fresh_unique_dates: print(f" Date range: {fresh_unique_dates[0]} to {fresh_unique_dates[-1]}") # Check for pre-June 2023 dates in fresh data fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] for fresh_date in fresh_unique_dates: # Pre-June 2023 check if any(year in fresh_date for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) elif '2023' in fresh_date and any(month in fresh_date.lower() for month in ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) # Future date check if any(str(year) in fresh_date for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): fresh_future.append(fresh_date) print(f" Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(fresh_pre_june)}") if fresh_pre_june: print(f" Examples: {fresh_pre_june[:5]}") print(f" Future dates: {len(fresh_future)}") if fresh_future: print(f" Examples: {fresh_future[:5]}") fresh_data_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access fresh history: HTTP {fresh_response.status_code}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing fresh history: {str(e)}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False # Also check page creation information print("\n=== CHECKING PAGE CREATION INFORMATION ===\n") info_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=info" print(f"Accessing page information: {info_url}") try: info_response = requests.get(info_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if info_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed page information") info_soup = BeautifulSoup(info_response.content, 'html.parser') info_text = info_soup.get_text() # Look for creation-related information creation_keywords = ['page creation', 'first edit', 'created', 'oldest revision'] creation_info = [] for keyword in creation_keywords: if keyword.lower() in info_text.lower(): # Find the context around this keyword lines = info_text.split('\n') for line in lines: if keyword.lower() in line.lower(): creation_info.append(line.strip()) print(f"\nCreation information found: {len(creation_info)} entries") for i, info in enumerate(creation_info, 1): print(f" {i}. {info[:200]}...") # First 200 chars # Save page info info_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_page_info.html') with open(info_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(info_response.text) page_info_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access page information: HTTP {info_response.status_code}") creation_info = [] page_info_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing page information: {str(e)}") creation_info = [] page_info_success = False # Final comprehensive analysis print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") # Determine the accuracy of the June 2023 claim based on ALL evidence june_2023_claim_accurate = True contradictory_evidence = [] evidence_sources = [] data_quality_concerns = [] # Check evidence from existing history file if pre_june_2023_dates: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in pre_june_2023_dates: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Cached history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("cached_history_file") # Check evidence from fresh data if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() and fresh_pre_june: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in fresh_pre_june: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Fresh history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("fresh_history_data") # Document data quality issues if future_dates: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Cached data: {date}" for date in future_dates]) if 'fresh_future' in locals() and fresh_future: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Fresh data: {date}" for date in fresh_future]) # Compile final results final_results = { 'verification_objective': 'Final corrected verification of Antidisestablishmentarianism Wikipedia page creation date', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'original_claim': 'Page has no edit history before June 2023', 'verification_conclusion': { 'june_2023_claim_accurate': june_2023_claim_accurate, 'confidence_level': 'high' if not data_quality_concerns else 'medium', 'contradictory_evidence_count': len(contradictory_evidence), 'data_quality_issues_count': len(data_quality_concerns) }, 'evidence_summary': { 'cached_history_analysis': { 'revision_entries_found': len(revision_entries), 'unique_dates_found': len(unique_dates), 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(pre_june_2023_dates), 'future_dates_found': len(future_dates) }, 'fresh_data_analysis': { 'access_successful': fresh_data_success, 'unique_dates_found': len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(fresh_pre_june) if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() else 0, 'future_dates_found': len(fresh_future) if 'fresh_future' in locals() else 0 }, 'page_info_analysis': { 'access_successful': page_info_success if 'page_info_success' in locals() else False, 'creation_info_entries': len(creation_info) if 'creation_info' in locals() else 0 } }, 'contradictory_evidence': contradictory_evidence, 'data_quality_concerns': data_quality_concerns, 'evidence_sources': evidence_sources, 'files_created': [ f for f in os.listdir(workspace_dir) if f.endswith('.html') and 'fresh' in f or 'info' in f ] } # Save final results final_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_final_corrected_verification.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"=== VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023") print(f"üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: {'‚úÖ ACCURATE' if june_2023_claim_accurate else '‚ùå CONTRADICTED'}") if not june_2023_claim_accurate: print(f"\n‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND ({len(contradictory_evidence)} items):") for evidence in contradictory_evidence[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {evidence}") if len(contradictory_evidence) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(contradictory_evidence) - 10} more") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è DATA QUALITY CONCERNS ({len(data_quality_concerns)} items):") print(f" Found impossible future dates suggesting test/sandbox content") for concern in data_quality_concerns[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" - {concern}") if len(data_quality_concerns) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(data_quality_concerns) - 5} more") print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Cached revision entries: {len(revision_entries)}") print(f" Cached unique dates: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f" Fresh data dates: {len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Evidence sources: {', '.join(evidence_sources) if evidence_sources else 'None'}") print(f" Confidence level: {final_results['verification_conclusion']['confidence_level']}") print(f"\nüíæ Final results saved to: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}") print(f"\n=== DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION ===\n") if june_2023_claim_accurate: print("‚úÖ CONCLUSION: The original claim is ACCURATE.") print(" No evidence found of page revisions before June 2023.") if data_quality_concerns: print(" Note: Some data quality issues detected but do not affect the conclusion.") else: print("‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED.") print(f" Found {len(contradictory_evidence)} pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.") print(f" Evidence comes from: {', '.join(evidence_sources)}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f" ‚ö†Ô∏è However, {len(data_quality_concerns)} data quality issues detected.") print(" Results should be interpreted with caution due to impossible future dates.") print(f"\nüîç RECOMMENDATION:") if data_quality_concerns: print(" Manual review recommended due to data quality concerns.") print(" The presence of future dates suggests test/sandbox content.") else: print(" Analysis complete with high confidence in results.") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis files saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")

Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import time import os from urllib.parse import quote, unquote import re print("=== FINAL VERIFICATION: PROPERLY SCOPED DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print("Objective: Complete verification with correctly scoped variables\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Analyze the existing history file with properly scoped variables print("=== ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH PROPER VARIABLE SCOPING ===\n") history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'history_page_raw.html') if os.path.exists(history_file): print(f"Analyzing history file: {os.path.basename(history_file)}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(history_file):,} bytes") with open(history_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: history_content = f.read() history_soup = BeautifulSoup(history_content, 'html.parser') # Extract revision entries systematically print("\nExtracting revision entries with systematic approach...") all_lis = history_soup.find_all('li') revision_entries = [] for i, li in enumerate(all_lis): li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_html = str(li) # Check if this list item contains revision-like content has_diff = 'diff' in li_html.lower() or 'hist' in li_html.lower() has_date = re.search(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', li_text) has_user = 'talk' in li_text.lower() or 'contribs' in li_text.lower() or 'user:' in li_text.lower() if (has_diff or has_date or has_user) and len(li_text) > 20: # Extract dates from this entry date_patterns = [ r'(\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})', # 12:34, 5 June 2023 r'(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})', # 2023-06-05 r'(\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4})', # June 5, 2023 r'(\d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})' # 5 June 2023 ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, li_text) found_dates.extend(matches) revision_entries.append({ 'index': i, 'text': li_text[:300], # First 300 chars 'dates': found_dates, 'has_diff': has_diff, 'has_user': has_user, 'full_text': li_text }) print(f"Found {len(revision_entries)} potential revision entries") # Extract all dates and analyze them with properly scoped variables all_dates_found = [] for entry in revision_entries: all_dates_found.extend(entry['dates']) if all_dates_found: unique_dates = sorted(set(all_dates_found)) print(f"\n=== DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print(f"Total unique dates found: {len(unique_dates)}") # Show sample dates print(f"\nFirst 10 dates: {unique_dates[:10]}") if len(unique_dates) > 10: print(f"Last 10 dates: {unique_dates[-10:]}") # Analyze dates with properly scoped variables - Fixed the scoping issue pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] current_year = datetime.now().year print(f"\nAnalyzing each date for timeline classification...") for date_string in unique_dates: # Clear, properly scoped variable name print(f"Processing date: {date_string}") # Check for dates before June 2023 is_pre_june_2023 = False if any(year in date_string for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Pre-2023 date found: {date_string}") elif '2023' in date_string: early_2023_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'jan', 'feb', 'mar', 'apr'] if any(month in date_string.lower() for month in early_2023_months): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Early 2023 date found: {date_string}") # Check for impossible future dates is_future_date = False if any(str(year) in date_string for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): is_future_date = True future_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Future date found: {date_string}") # Classify as valid if not future date if not is_future_date: valid_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Valid date: {date_string}") print(f"\n=== DATE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total dates analyzed: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f"Valid dates (not future): {len(valid_dates)}") print(f"Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(pre_june_2023_dates)}") print(f"Future dates (data quality issues): {len(future_dates)}") if pre_june_2023_dates: print(f"\nüìÖ PRE-JUNE 2023 DATES FOUND:") for date in pre_june_2023_dates: print(f" - {date}") if future_dates: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è FUTURE DATES FOUND (DATA QUALITY ISSUES):") for date in future_dates[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {date}") if len(future_dates) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(future_dates) - 10} more") print(f"\nThis indicates test/sandbox content or data corruption") else: print("\n‚ùå No dates found in revision entries") unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] else: print(f"‚ùå History file not found: {history_file}") revision_entries = [] unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] # Access fresh Wikipedia data for comparison print("\n=== ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION ===\n") page_title = "Antidisestablishmentarianism" history_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=history" headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Accessing fresh history page: {history_url}") try: fresh_response = requests.get(history_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if fresh_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page") print(f"Content length: {len(fresh_response.content):,} bytes") # Save fresh history for comparison fresh_history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_history_fresh.html') with open(fresh_history_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(fresh_response.text) # Quick analysis of fresh data fresh_soup = BeautifulSoup(fresh_response.content, 'html.parser') fresh_text = fresh_soup.get_text() # Look for dates in fresh content fresh_dates = re.findall(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', fresh_text) fresh_unique_dates = sorted(set(fresh_dates)) print(f"\nFresh data analysis:") print(f" Total dates found: {len(fresh_unique_dates)}") if fresh_unique_dates: print(f" Date range: {fresh_unique_dates[0]} to {fresh_unique_dates[-1]}") # Check for pre-June 2023 dates in fresh data with proper scoping fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] for fresh_date_string in fresh_unique_dates: # Properly scoped variable # Pre-June 2023 check if any(year in fresh_date_string for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date_string) elif '2023' in fresh_date_string and any(month in fresh_date_string.lower() for month in ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date_string) # Future date check if any(str(year) in fresh_date_string for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): fresh_future.append(fresh_date_string) print(f" Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(fresh_pre_june)}") if fresh_pre_june: print(f" Examples: {fresh_pre_june[:5]}") print(f" Future dates: {len(fresh_future)}") if fresh_future: print(f" Examples: {fresh_future[:5]}") fresh_data_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access fresh history: HTTP {fresh_response.status_code}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing fresh history: {str(e)}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False # Final comprehensive analysis print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") # Determine the accuracy of the June 2023 claim based on ALL evidence june_2023_claim_accurate = True contradictory_evidence = [] evidence_sources = [] data_quality_concerns = [] # Check evidence from existing history file if pre_june_2023_dates: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in pre_june_2023_dates: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Cached history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("cached_history_file") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(pre_june_2023_dates)} pre-June 2023 dates in cached history") # Check evidence from fresh data if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() and fresh_pre_june: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in fresh_pre_june: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Fresh history: {date}") if "fresh_history_data" not in evidence_sources: evidence_sources.append("fresh_history_data") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(fresh_pre_june)} pre-June 2023 dates in fresh history") # Document data quality issues if future_dates: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Cached data: {date}" for date in future_dates]) print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(future_dates)} future dates in cached data") if 'fresh_future' in locals() and fresh_future: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Fresh data: {date}" for date in fresh_future]) print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(fresh_future)} future dates in fresh data") # Compile final results final_results = { 'verification_objective': 'Final corrected verification of Antidisestablishmentarianism Wikipedia page creation date', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'original_claim': 'Page has no edit history before June 2023', 'verification_conclusion': { 'june_2023_claim_accurate': june_2023_claim_accurate, 'confidence_level': 'low' if data_quality_concerns else 'high', 'contradictory_evidence_count': len(contradictory_evidence), 'data_quality_issues_count': len(data_quality_concerns) }, 'evidence_summary': { 'cached_history_analysis': { 'revision_entries_found': len(revision_entries), 'unique_dates_found': len(unique_dates), 'valid_dates': len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(pre_june_2023_dates), 'future_dates_found': len(future_dates) }, 'fresh_data_analysis': { 'access_successful': fresh_data_success, 'unique_dates_found': len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(fresh_pre_june) if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() else 0, 'future_dates_found': len(fresh_future) if 'fresh_future' in locals() else 0 } }, 'contradictory_evidence': contradictory_evidence, 'data_quality_concerns': data_quality_concerns, 'evidence_sources': evidence_sources } # Save final results final_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_final_verification_complete.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023") print(f"üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: {'‚úÖ ACCURATE' if june_2023_claim_accurate else '‚ùå CONTRADICTED'}") if not june_2023_claim_accurate: print(f"\n‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND ({len(contradictory_evidence)} items):") for evidence in contradictory_evidence: print(f" - {evidence}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è DATA QUALITY CONCERNS ({len(data_quality_concerns)} items):") print(f" Found impossible future dates suggesting test/sandbox content") print(f" This significantly reduces confidence in the analysis") print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Cached revision entries: {len(revision_entries)}") print(f" Cached unique dates: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f" Valid dates (non-future): {len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Fresh data dates: {len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Evidence sources: {', '.join(evidence_sources) if evidence_sources else 'None'}") print(f" Confidence level: {final_results['verification_conclusion']['confidence_level']}") print(f"\nüíæ Final results saved to: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}") print(f"\n=== DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION ===\n") if june_2023_claim_accurate: print("‚úÖ CONCLUSION: The original claim is ACCURATE.") print(" No evidence found of page revisions before June 2023.") else: print("‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED.") print(f" Found {len(contradictory_evidence)} pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.") print(f" Evidence comes from: {', '.join(evidence_sources)}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL DATA QUALITY ISSUES DETECTED:") print(f" Found {len(data_quality_concerns)} impossible future dates (2025, 2024)") print(f" This suggests the page contains test/sandbox content or data corruption") print(f" Confidence level reduced to: {final_results['verification_conclusion']['confidence_level']}") print(f" Results should be interpreted with extreme caution") print(f"\nüîç FINAL RECOMMENDATION:") if data_quality_concerns: print(" The presence of impossible future dates indicates this may be test/sandbox content") print(" Manual verification through Wikipedia's official channels is strongly recommended") print(" The page may not represent legitimate Wikipedia content") else: print(" Analysis complete with high confidence in results") print(" No data quality issues detected") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis files saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered another NameError on line 97 due to variable scoping issues in the date analysis loop. The script successfully extracted 50 revision entries and found 68 unique dates, all showing impossible future dates from 2024-2025 (e.g., '00:50, 23 May 2025', '01:36, 8 May 2025'), but crashed when trying to analyze these dates. The error occurred in the generator expression where 'date_entry' was referenced outside its proper scope. Key findings before crash: (1) Successfully parsed 220,232-byte history file, (2) Found substantial revision history with 68 dates, (3) All dates are from 2024-2025, which are impossible future dates indicating this is test/sandbox content rather than legitimate Wikipedia data. **PLAN** alignment: 75% complete - gathered critical evidence but failed to complete analysis due to persistent variable scoping errors. The impossible future dates strongly suggest this page contains corrupted or test data, making the original June 2023 claim verification unreliable. Next step: Fix the variable scoping by using a simple for loop instead of generator expressions, and add explicit handling for the data quality issues revealed by these impossible future dates.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import time import os from urllib.parse import quote, unquote import re print("=== FINAL VERIFICATION: PROPERLY SCOPED DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print("Objective: Complete verification with correctly scoped variables\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Analyze the existing history file with properly scoped variables print("=== ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH PROPER VARIABLE SCOPING ===\n") history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'history_page_raw.html') if os.path.exists(history_file): print(f"Analyzing history file: {os.path.basename(history_file)}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(history_file):,} bytes") with open(history_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: history_content = f.read() history_soup = BeautifulSoup(history_content, 'html.parser') # Extract revision entries systematically print("\nExtracting revision entries with systematic approach...") all_lis = history_soup.find_all('li') revision_entries = [] for i, li in enumerate(all_lis): li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_html = str(li) # Check if this list item contains revision-like content has_diff = 'diff' in li_html.lower() or 'hist' in li_html.lower() has_date = re.search(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', li_text) has_user = 'talk' in li_text.lower() or 'contribs' in li_text.lower() or 'user:' in li_text.lower() if (has_diff or has_date or has_user) and len(li_text) > 20: # Extract dates from this entry date_patterns = [ r'(\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})', # 12:34, 5 June 2023 r'(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})', # 2023-06-05 r'(\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4})', # June 5, 2023 r'(\d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})' # 5 June 2023 ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, li_text) found_dates.extend(matches) revision_entries.append({ 'index': i, 'text': li_text[:300], # First 300 chars 'dates': found_dates, 'has_diff': has_diff, 'has_user': has_user, 'full_text': li_text }) print(f"Found {len(revision_entries)} potential revision entries") # Extract all dates and analyze them with properly scoped variables all_dates_found = [] for entry in revision_entries: all_dates_found.extend(entry['dates']) if all_dates_found: unique_dates = sorted(set(all_dates_found)) print(f"\n=== DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print(f"Total unique dates found: {len(unique_dates)}") # Show sample dates print(f"\nFirst 10 dates: {unique_dates[:10]}") if len(unique_dates) > 10: print(f"Last 10 dates: {unique_dates[-10:]}") # Analyze dates with properly scoped variables - Fixed the scoping issue pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] current_year = datetime.now().year print(f"\nAnalyzing each date for timeline classification...") for date_string in unique_dates: # Clear, properly scoped variable name print(f"Processing date: {date_string}") # Check for dates before June 2023 is_pre_june_2023 = False if any(year in date_string for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Pre-2023 date found: {date_string}") elif '2023' in date_string: early_2023_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'jan', 'feb', 'mar', 'apr'] if any(month in date_string.lower() for month in early_2023_months): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Early 2023 date found: {date_string}") # Check for impossible future dates is_future_date = False if any(str(year) in date_string for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): is_future_date = True future_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Future date found: {date_string}") # Classify as valid if not future date if not is_future_date: valid_dates.append(date_string) print(f" -> Valid date: {date_string}") print(f"\n=== DATE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total dates analyzed: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f"Valid dates (not future): {len(valid_dates)}") print(f"Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(pre_june_2023_dates)}") print(f"Future dates (data quality issues): {len(future_dates)}") if pre_june_2023_dates: print(f"\nüìÖ PRE-JUNE 2023 DATES FOUND:") for date in pre_june_2023_dates: print(f" - {date}") if future_dates: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è FUTURE DATES FOUND (DATA QUALITY ISSUES):") for date in future_dates[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {date}") if len(future_dates) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(future_dates) - 10} more") print(f"\nThis indicates test/sandbox content or data corruption") else: print("\n‚ùå No dates found in revision entries") unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] else: print(f"‚ùå History file not found: {history_file}") revision_entries = [] unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] # Access fresh Wikipedia data for comparison print("\n=== ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION ===\n") page_title = "Antidisestablishmentarianism" history_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=history" headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Accessing fresh history page: {history_url}") try: fresh_response = requests.get(history_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if fresh_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page") print(f"Content length: {len(fresh_response.content):,} bytes") # Save fresh history for comparison fresh_history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_history_fresh.html') with open(fresh_history_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(fresh_response.text) # Quick analysis of fresh data fresh_soup = BeautifulSoup(fresh_response.content, 'html.parser') fresh_text = fresh_soup.get_text() # Look for dates in fresh content fresh_dates = re.findall(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', fresh_text) fresh_unique_dates = sorted(set(fresh_dates)) print(f"\nFresh data analysis:") print(f" Total dates found: {len(fresh_unique_dates)}") if fresh_unique_dates: print(f" Date range: {fresh_unique_dates[0]} to {fresh_unique_dates[-1]}") # Check for pre-June 2023 dates in fresh data with proper scoping fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] for fresh_date_string in fresh_unique_dates: # Properly scoped variable # Pre-June 2023 check if any(year in fresh_date_string for year in ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date_string) elif '2023' in fresh_date_string and any(month in fresh_date_string.lower() for month in ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may']): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date_string) # Future date check if any(str(year) in fresh_date_string for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)): fresh_future.append(fresh_date_string) print(f" Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(fresh_pre_june)}") if fresh_pre_june: print(f" Examples: {fresh_pre_june[:5]}") print(f" Future dates: {len(fresh_future)}") if fresh_future: print(f" Examples: {fresh_future[:5]}") fresh_data_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access fresh history: HTTP {fresh_response.status_code}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing fresh history: {str(e)}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False # Final comprehensive analysis print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") # Determine the accuracy of the June 2023 claim based on ALL evidence june_2023_claim_accurate = True contradictory_evidence = [] evidence_sources = [] data_quality_concerns = [] # Check evidence from existing history file if pre_june_2023_dates: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in pre_june_2023_dates: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Cached history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("cached_history_file") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(pre_june_2023_dates)} pre-June 2023 dates in cached history") # Check evidence from fresh data if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() and fresh_pre_june: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in fresh_pre_june: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Fresh history: {date}") if "fresh_history_data" not in evidence_sources: evidence_sources.append("fresh_history_data") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(fresh_pre_june)} pre-June 2023 dates in fresh history") # Document data quality issues if future_dates: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Cached data: {date}" for date in future_dates]) print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(future_dates)} future dates in cached data") if 'fresh_future' in locals() and fresh_future: data_quality_concerns.extend([f"Fresh data: {date}" for date in fresh_future]) print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Found {len(fresh_future)} future dates in fresh data") # Compile final results final_results = { 'verification_objective': 'Final corrected verification of Antidisestablishmentarianism Wikipedia page creation date', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'original_claim': 'Page has no edit history before June 2023', 'verification_conclusion': { 'june_2023_claim_accurate': june_2023_claim_accurate, 'confidence_level': 'low' if data_quality_concerns else 'high', 'contradictory_evidence_count': len(contradictory_evidence), 'data_quality_issues_count': len(data_quality_concerns) }, 'evidence_summary': { 'cached_history_analysis': { 'revision_entries_found': len(revision_entries), 'unique_dates_found': len(unique_dates), 'valid_dates': len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(pre_june_2023_dates), 'future_dates_found': len(future_dates) }, 'fresh_data_analysis': { 'access_successful': fresh_data_success, 'unique_dates_found': len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(fresh_pre_june) if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() else 0, 'future_dates_found': len(fresh_future) if 'fresh_future' in locals() else 0 } }, 'contradictory_evidence': contradictory_evidence, 'data_quality_concerns': data_quality_concerns, 'evidence_sources': evidence_sources } # Save final results final_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_final_verification_complete.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023") print(f"üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: {'‚úÖ ACCURATE' if june_2023_claim_accurate else '‚ùå CONTRADICTED'}") if not june_2023_claim_accurate: print(f"\n‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND ({len(contradictory_evidence)} items):") for evidence in contradictory_evidence: print(f" - {evidence}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è DATA QUALITY CONCERNS ({len(data_quality_concerns)} items):") print(f" Found impossible future dates suggesting test/sandbox content") print(f" This significantly reduces confidence in the analysis") print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Cached revision entries: {len(revision_entries)}") print(f" Cached unique dates: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f" Valid dates (non-future): {len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Fresh data dates: {len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Evidence sources: {', '.join(evidence_sources) if evidence_sources else 'None'}") print(f" Confidence level: {final_results['verification_conclusion']['confidence_level']}") print(f"\nüíæ Final results saved to: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}") print(f"\n=== DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION ===\n") if june_2023_claim_accurate: print("‚úÖ CONCLUSION: The original claim is ACCURATE.") print(" No evidence found of page revisions before June 2023.") else: print("‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED.") print(f" Found {len(contradictory_evidence)} pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.") print(f" Evidence comes from: {', '.join(evidence_sources)}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL DATA QUALITY ISSUES DETECTED:") print(f" Found {len(data_quality_concerns)} impossible future dates (2025, 2024)") print(f" This suggests the page contains test/sandbox content or data corruption") print(f" Confidence level reduced to: {final_results['verification_conclusion']['confidence_level']}") print(f" Results should be interpreted with extreme caution") print(f"\nüîç FINAL RECOMMENDATION:") if data_quality_concerns: print(" The presence of impossible future dates indicates this may be test/sandbox content") print(" Manual verification through Wikipedia's official channels is strongly recommended") print(" The page may not represent legitimate Wikipedia content") else: print(" Analysis complete with high confidence in results") print(" No data quality issues detected") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis files saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FINAL VERIFICATION: PROPERLY SCOPED DATE ANALYSIS === Objective: Complete verification with correctly scoped variables Using existing workspace directory: workspace_f3917a3d-1d17-4ee2-90c5-683b072218fe === ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH PROPER VARIABLE SCOPING === Analyzing history file: history_page_raw.html File size: 220,232 bytes Extracting revision entries with systematic approach... Found 50 potential revision entries === DATE ANALYSIS === Total unique dates found: 68 First 10 dates: ['00:50, 23 May 2025', '00:50, 28 August 2024', '01:13, 29 May 2025', '01:15, 29 May 2025', '01:27, 22 April 2025', '01:36, 8 May 2025', '02:34, 29 August 2024', '02:41, 29 August 2024', '03:21, 20 January 2025', '04:02, 7 January 2025'] Last 10 dates: ['29 May 2025', '31 July 2024', '5 February 2025', '5 May 2025', '7 April 2025', '7 January 2025', '8 May 2025', '9 February 2025', '9 May 2025', '9 October 2024'] Analyzing each date for timeline classification... Processing date: 00:50, 23 May 2025 Execution error: NameError: name 'date_string' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/liujiarui.1/Documents/È°πÁõÆ/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 103, in <module> File "<string>", line 103, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'date_string' is not defined

2025-08-03 03:38:15
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 6)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import time import os from urllib.parse import quote, unquote import re print("=== FINAL VERIFICATION: USING SIMPLE LOOPS TO AVOID SCOPING ERRORS ===\n") print("Objective: Complete verification using explicit loops instead of generator expressions\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Analyze the existing history file with simple, explicit loops print("=== ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH EXPLICIT LOOPS ===\n") history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'history_page_raw.html') if os.path.exists(history_file): print(f"Analyzing history file: {os.path.basename(history_file)}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(history_file):,} bytes") with open(history_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: history_content = f.read() history_soup = BeautifulSoup(history_content, 'html.parser') # Extract revision entries systematically print("\nExtracting revision entries with systematic approach...") all_lis = history_soup.find_all('li') revision_entries = [] for i, li in enumerate(all_lis): li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_html = str(li) # Check if this list item contains revision-like content has_diff = 'diff' in li_html.lower() or 'hist' in li_html.lower() has_date = re.search(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', li_text) has_user = 'talk' in li_text.lower() or 'contribs' in li_text.lower() or 'user:' in li_text.lower() if (has_diff or has_date or has_user) and len(li_text) > 20: # Extract dates from this entry date_patterns = [ r'(\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})', # 12:34, 5 June 2023 r'(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})', # 2023-06-05 r'(\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4})', # June 5, 2023 r'(\d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})' # 5 June 2023 ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, li_text) found_dates.extend(matches) revision_entries.append({ 'index': i, 'text': li_text[:300], # First 300 chars 'dates': found_dates, 'has_diff': has_diff, 'has_user': has_user, 'full_text': li_text }) print(f"Found {len(revision_entries)} potential revision entries") # Extract all dates using simple loops to avoid scoping issues all_dates_found = [] for entry in revision_entries: for date_item in entry['dates']: all_dates_found.append(date_item) if all_dates_found: unique_dates = sorted(set(all_dates_found)) print(f"\n=== DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print(f"Total unique dates found: {len(unique_dates)}") # Show sample dates print(f"\nFirst 10 dates: {unique_dates[:10]}") if len(unique_dates) > 10: print(f"Last 10 dates: {unique_dates[-10:]}") # Analyze dates using explicit loops to avoid scoping issues pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] current_year = datetime.now().year print(f"\nAnalyzing each date for timeline classification...") print(f"Current year for reference: {current_year}") # Use explicit for loop instead of generator expressions for i, single_date in enumerate(unique_dates): print(f"Processing date {i+1}/{len(unique_dates)}: {single_date}") # Check for dates before June 2023 is_pre_june_2023 = False # Check for years before 2023 early_years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022'] for year in early_years: if year in single_date: is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Pre-2023 date found: {single_date}") break # Check for early 2023 months (before June) if not is_pre_june_2023 and '2023' in single_date: early_2023_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'jan', 'feb', 'mar', 'apr'] for month in early_2023_months: if month in single_date.lower(): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Early 2023 date found: {single_date}") break # Check for impossible future dates is_future_date = False future_years = [str(year) for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)] for year in future_years: if year in single_date: is_future_date = True future_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> IMPOSSIBLE FUTURE DATE: {single_date}") break # Classify as valid if not future date if not is_future_date: valid_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Valid date: {single_date}") # Limit output for readability if i >= 19: # Show first 20 dates print(f" ... (showing first 20 of {len(unique_dates)} dates)") break print(f"\n=== DATE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total dates analyzed: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f"Valid dates (not future): {len(valid_dates)}") print(f"Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(pre_june_2023_dates)}") print(f"Future dates (data quality issues): {len(future_dates)}") if pre_june_2023_dates: print(f"\nüìÖ PRE-JUNE 2023 DATES FOUND:") for date in pre_june_2023_dates: print(f" - {date}") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ No pre-June 2023 dates found in cached data") if future_dates: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: IMPOSSIBLE FUTURE DATES FOUND:") print(f"Found {len(future_dates)} impossible future dates:") for date in future_dates[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {date}") if len(future_dates) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(future_dates) - 10} more") print(f"\nüö® This strongly indicates TEST/SANDBOX content or data corruption") print(f"üö® The page may not represent legitimate Wikipedia revision history") else: print("\n‚ùå No dates found in revision entries") unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] else: print(f"‚ùå History file not found: {history_file}") revision_entries = [] unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] # Access fresh Wikipedia data for comparison print("\n=== ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION ===\n") page_title = "Antidisestablishmentarianism" history_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=history" headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Accessing fresh history page: {history_url}") try: fresh_response = requests.get(history_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if fresh_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page") print(f"Content length: {len(fresh_response.content):,} bytes") # Save fresh history for comparison fresh_history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_history_fresh.html') with open(fresh_history_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(fresh_response.text) # Quick analysis of fresh data fresh_soup = BeautifulSoup(fresh_response.content, 'html.parser') fresh_text = fresh_soup.get_text() # Look for dates in fresh content fresh_dates = re.findall(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', fresh_text) fresh_unique_dates = sorted(set(fresh_dates)) print(f"\nFresh data analysis:") print(f" Total dates found: {len(fresh_unique_dates)}") if fresh_unique_dates: print(f" Date range: {fresh_unique_dates[0]} to {fresh_unique_dates[-1]}") # Check for pre-June 2023 dates in fresh data using explicit loops fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] for fresh_date in fresh_unique_dates: # Pre-June 2023 check using explicit loops is_fresh_pre_june = False early_years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022'] for year in early_years: if year in fresh_date: fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) is_fresh_pre_june = True break if not is_fresh_pre_june and '2023' in fresh_date: early_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may'] for month in early_months: if month in fresh_date.lower(): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) break # Future date check using explicit loops future_years = [str(year) for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)] for year in future_years: if year in fresh_date: fresh_future.append(fresh_date) break print(f" Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(fresh_pre_june)}") if fresh_pre_june: print(f" Examples: {fresh_pre_june[:5]}") print(f" Future dates: {len(fresh_future)}") if fresh_future: print(f" Examples: {fresh_future[:5]}") fresh_data_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access fresh history: HTTP {fresh_response.status_code}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing fresh history: {str(e)}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False # Final comprehensive analysis print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") # Determine the accuracy of the June 2023 claim based on ALL evidence june_2023_claim_accurate = True contradictory_evidence = [] evidence_sources = [] data_quality_concerns = [] confidence_level = 'high' # Check evidence from existing history file if pre_june_2023_dates: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in pre_june_2023_dates: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Cached history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("cached_history_file") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(pre_june_2023_dates)} pre-June 2023 dates in cached history") # Check evidence from fresh data if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() and fresh_pre_june: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in fresh_pre_june: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Fresh history: {date}") if "fresh_history_data" not in evidence_sources: evidence_sources.append("fresh_history_data") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(fresh_pre_june)} pre-June 2023 dates in fresh history") # Document data quality issues if future_dates: for date in future_dates: data_quality_concerns.append(f"Cached data: {date}") confidence_level = 'very_low' print(f"üö® CRITICAL: Found {len(future_dates)} impossible future dates in cached data") if 'fresh_future' in locals() and fresh_future: for date in fresh_future: data_quality_concerns.append(f"Fresh data: {date}") confidence_level = 'very_low' print(f"üö® CRITICAL: Found {len(fresh_future)} impossible future dates in fresh data") # Compile final results final_results = { 'verification_objective': 'Final verification of Antidisestablishmentarianism Wikipedia page creation date', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'original_claim': 'Page has no edit history before June 2023', 'verification_conclusion': { 'june_2023_claim_accurate': june_2023_claim_accurate, 'confidence_level': confidence_level, 'contradictory_evidence_count': len(contradictory_evidence), 'data_quality_issues_count': len(data_quality_concerns), 'analysis_reliability': 'unreliable' if data_quality_concerns else 'reliable' }, 'evidence_summary': { 'cached_history_analysis': { 'revision_entries_found': len(revision_entries), 'unique_dates_found': len(unique_dates), 'valid_dates': len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(pre_june_2023_dates), 'future_dates_found': len(future_dates) }, 'fresh_data_analysis': { 'access_successful': fresh_data_success if 'fresh_data_success' in locals() else False, 'unique_dates_found': len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(fresh_pre_june) if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() else 0, 'future_dates_found': len(fresh_future) if 'fresh_future' in locals() else 0 } }, 'contradictory_evidence': contradictory_evidence, 'data_quality_concerns': data_quality_concerns, 'evidence_sources': evidence_sources } # Save final results final_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_verification_final.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023") print(f"üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: {'‚úÖ ACCURATE' if june_2023_claim_accurate else '‚ùå CONTRADICTED'}") print(f"üîç CONFIDENCE LEVEL: {confidence_level.upper()}") if not june_2023_claim_accurate: print(f"\n‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND ({len(contradictory_evidence)} items):") for evidence in contradictory_evidence: print(f" - {evidence}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\nüö® CRITICAL DATA QUALITY ISSUES ({len(data_quality_concerns)} items):") print(f" Found impossible future dates from 2024-2025") print(f" This indicates TEST/SANDBOX content or data corruption") print(f" The page likely does NOT represent legitimate Wikipedia content") print(f" Examples of impossible dates:") for concern in data_quality_concerns[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" - {concern}") if len(data_quality_concerns) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(data_quality_concerns) - 5} more") print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Cached revision entries: {len(revision_entries)}") print(f" Cached unique dates: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f" Valid dates (non-future): {len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Fresh data dates: {len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Evidence sources: {', '.join(evidence_sources) if evidence_sources else 'None'}") print(f"\nüíæ Final results saved to: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}") print(f"\n=== DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION ===\n") if june_2023_claim_accurate: print("‚úÖ CONCLUSION: The original claim appears to be ACCURATE.") print(" No evidence found of page revisions before June 2023.") else: print("‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED.") print(f" Found {len(contradictory_evidence)} pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.") print(f" Evidence comes from: {', '.join(evidence_sources)}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\nüö® CRITICAL FINDING: DATA INTEGRITY COMPROMISED") print(f" The presence of {len(data_quality_concerns)} impossible future dates (2024-2025)") print(f" strongly suggests this is NOT legitimate Wikipedia content.") print(f" This appears to be test/sandbox data or corrupted content.") print(f" \n RECOMMENDATION: The verification is INCONCLUSIVE due to data corruption.") print(f" Manual verification through official Wikipedia channels is required.") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ Data quality appears acceptable for drawing conclusions.") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis files saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")

Tester Feedback:
Execution successful - Code ran without errors and completed the comprehensive verification analysis. The script successfully analyzed the existing 220,232-byte history file, found 68 unique dates, and accessed fresh Wikipedia data for cross-verification. Key findings: (1) Found 1 piece of contradictory evidence showing a revision date from 2020-07-13 in the fresh Wikipedia data, directly contradicting the original claim, (2) Successfully categorized all dates and identified data quality issues with impossible future dates from 2024-2025, (3) Generated definitive conclusion that the original June 2023 claim is CONTRADICTED, (4) Saved comprehensive results to 'antidisestablishmentarianism_verification_final.json' with detailed evidence analysis. **PLAN** alignment: 100% complete - the verification objective has been fully achieved. The analysis found concrete evidence (2020-07-13 date) proving the Wikipedia page has edit history before June 2023, definitively answering the verification question. The presence of future dates suggests data quality issues, but the fresh Wikipedia data provided reliable contradictory evidence. No further development is needed as the verification is complete with high confidence results.
Python Code python
import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import json from datetime import datetime import time import os from urllib.parse import quote, unquote import re print("=== FINAL VERIFICATION: USING SIMPLE LOOPS TO AVOID SCOPING ERRORS ===\n") print("Objective: Complete verification using explicit loops instead of generator expressions\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir('.') if d.startswith('workspace')] if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Analyze the existing history file with simple, explicit loops print("=== ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH EXPLICIT LOOPS ===\n") history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'history_page_raw.html') if os.path.exists(history_file): print(f"Analyzing history file: {os.path.basename(history_file)}") print(f"File size: {os.path.getsize(history_file):,} bytes") with open(history_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: history_content = f.read() history_soup = BeautifulSoup(history_content, 'html.parser') # Extract revision entries systematically print("\nExtracting revision entries with systematic approach...") all_lis = history_soup.find_all('li') revision_entries = [] for i, li in enumerate(all_lis): li_text = li.get_text().strip() li_html = str(li) # Check if this list item contains revision-like content has_diff = 'diff' in li_html.lower() or 'hist' in li_html.lower() has_date = re.search(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', li_text) has_user = 'talk' in li_text.lower() or 'contribs' in li_text.lower() or 'user:' in li_text.lower() if (has_diff or has_date or has_user) and len(li_text) > 20: # Extract dates from this entry date_patterns = [ r'(\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})', # 12:34, 5 June 2023 r'(\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2})', # 2023-06-05 r'(\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4})', # June 5, 2023 r'(\d{1,2} \w+ \d{4})' # 5 June 2023 ] found_dates = [] for pattern in date_patterns: matches = re.findall(pattern, li_text) found_dates.extend(matches) revision_entries.append({ 'index': i, 'text': li_text[:300], # First 300 chars 'dates': found_dates, 'has_diff': has_diff, 'has_user': has_user, 'full_text': li_text }) print(f"Found {len(revision_entries)} potential revision entries") # Extract all dates using simple loops to avoid scoping issues all_dates_found = [] for entry in revision_entries: for date_item in entry['dates']: all_dates_found.append(date_item) if all_dates_found: unique_dates = sorted(set(all_dates_found)) print(f"\n=== DATE ANALYSIS ===\n") print(f"Total unique dates found: {len(unique_dates)}") # Show sample dates print(f"\nFirst 10 dates: {unique_dates[:10]}") if len(unique_dates) > 10: print(f"Last 10 dates: {unique_dates[-10:]}") # Analyze dates using explicit loops to avoid scoping issues pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] current_year = datetime.now().year print(f"\nAnalyzing each date for timeline classification...") print(f"Current year for reference: {current_year}") # Use explicit for loop instead of generator expressions for i, single_date in enumerate(unique_dates): print(f"Processing date {i+1}/{len(unique_dates)}: {single_date}") # Check for dates before June 2023 is_pre_june_2023 = False # Check for years before 2023 early_years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022'] for year in early_years: if year in single_date: is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Pre-2023 date found: {single_date}") break # Check for early 2023 months (before June) if not is_pre_june_2023 and '2023' in single_date: early_2023_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may', 'jan', 'feb', 'mar', 'apr'] for month in early_2023_months: if month in single_date.lower(): is_pre_june_2023 = True pre_june_2023_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Early 2023 date found: {single_date}") break # Check for impossible future dates is_future_date = False future_years = [str(year) for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)] for year in future_years: if year in single_date: is_future_date = True future_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> IMPOSSIBLE FUTURE DATE: {single_date}") break # Classify as valid if not future date if not is_future_date: valid_dates.append(single_date) print(f" -> Valid date: {single_date}") # Limit output for readability if i >= 19: # Show first 20 dates print(f" ... (showing first 20 of {len(unique_dates)} dates)") break print(f"\n=== DATE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") print(f"Total dates analyzed: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f"Valid dates (not future): {len(valid_dates)}") print(f"Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(pre_june_2023_dates)}") print(f"Future dates (data quality issues): {len(future_dates)}") if pre_june_2023_dates: print(f"\nüìÖ PRE-JUNE 2023 DATES FOUND:") for date in pre_june_2023_dates: print(f" - {date}") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ No pre-June 2023 dates found in cached data") if future_dates: print(f"\n‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: IMPOSSIBLE FUTURE DATES FOUND:") print(f"Found {len(future_dates)} impossible future dates:") for date in future_dates[:10]: # Show first 10 print(f" - {date}") if len(future_dates) > 10: print(f" ... and {len(future_dates) - 10} more") print(f"\nüö® This strongly indicates TEST/SANDBOX content or data corruption") print(f"üö® The page may not represent legitimate Wikipedia revision history") else: print("\n‚ùå No dates found in revision entries") unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] else: print(f"‚ùå History file not found: {history_file}") revision_entries = [] unique_dates = [] pre_june_2023_dates = [] future_dates = [] valid_dates = [] # Access fresh Wikipedia data for comparison print("\n=== ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION ===\n") page_title = "Antidisestablishmentarianism" history_url = f"https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title={quote(page_title)}&action=history" headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Accessing fresh history page: {history_url}") try: fresh_response = requests.get(history_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) if fresh_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page") print(f"Content length: {len(fresh_response.content):,} bytes") # Save fresh history for comparison fresh_history_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_history_fresh.html') with open(fresh_history_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(fresh_response.text) # Quick analysis of fresh data fresh_soup = BeautifulSoup(fresh_response.content, 'html.parser') fresh_text = fresh_soup.get_text() # Look for dates in fresh content fresh_dates = re.findall(r'\d{1,2}:\d{2}, \d{1,2} \w+ \d{4}|\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}|\w+ \d{1,2}, \d{4}', fresh_text) fresh_unique_dates = sorted(set(fresh_dates)) print(f"\nFresh data analysis:") print(f" Total dates found: {len(fresh_unique_dates)}") if fresh_unique_dates: print(f" Date range: {fresh_unique_dates[0]} to {fresh_unique_dates[-1]}") # Check for pre-June 2023 dates in fresh data using explicit loops fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] for fresh_date in fresh_unique_dates: # Pre-June 2023 check using explicit loops is_fresh_pre_june = False early_years = ['2019', '2020', '2021', '2022'] for year in early_years: if year in fresh_date: fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) is_fresh_pre_june = True break if not is_fresh_pre_june and '2023' in fresh_date: early_months = ['january', 'february', 'march', 'april', 'may'] for month in early_months: if month in fresh_date.lower(): fresh_pre_june.append(fresh_date) break # Future date check using explicit loops future_years = [str(year) for year in range(current_year + 1, 2030)] for year in future_years: if year in fresh_date: fresh_future.append(fresh_date) break print(f" Pre-June 2023 dates: {len(fresh_pre_june)}") if fresh_pre_june: print(f" Examples: {fresh_pre_june[:5]}") print(f" Future dates: {len(fresh_future)}") if fresh_future: print(f" Examples: {fresh_future[:5]}") fresh_data_success = True else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to access fresh history: HTTP {fresh_response.status_code}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False except Exception as e: print(f"‚ùå Error accessing fresh history: {str(e)}") fresh_unique_dates = [] fresh_pre_june = [] fresh_future = [] fresh_data_success = False # Final comprehensive analysis print("\n=== FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS ===\n") # Determine the accuracy of the June 2023 claim based on ALL evidence june_2023_claim_accurate = True contradictory_evidence = [] evidence_sources = [] data_quality_concerns = [] confidence_level = 'high' # Check evidence from existing history file if pre_june_2023_dates: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in pre_june_2023_dates: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Cached history: {date}") evidence_sources.append("cached_history_file") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(pre_june_2023_dates)} pre-June 2023 dates in cached history") # Check evidence from fresh data if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() and fresh_pre_june: june_2023_claim_accurate = False for date in fresh_pre_june: contradictory_evidence.append(f"Fresh history: {date}") if "fresh_history_data" not in evidence_sources: evidence_sources.append("fresh_history_data") print(f"‚ùå Found {len(fresh_pre_june)} pre-June 2023 dates in fresh history") # Document data quality issues if future_dates: for date in future_dates: data_quality_concerns.append(f"Cached data: {date}") confidence_level = 'very_low' print(f"üö® CRITICAL: Found {len(future_dates)} impossible future dates in cached data") if 'fresh_future' in locals() and fresh_future: for date in fresh_future: data_quality_concerns.append(f"Fresh data: {date}") confidence_level = 'very_low' print(f"üö® CRITICAL: Found {len(fresh_future)} impossible future dates in fresh data") # Compile final results final_results = { 'verification_objective': 'Final verification of Antidisestablishmentarianism Wikipedia page creation date', 'analysis_timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'original_claim': 'Page has no edit history before June 2023', 'verification_conclusion': { 'june_2023_claim_accurate': june_2023_claim_accurate, 'confidence_level': confidence_level, 'contradictory_evidence_count': len(contradictory_evidence), 'data_quality_issues_count': len(data_quality_concerns), 'analysis_reliability': 'unreliable' if data_quality_concerns else 'reliable' }, 'evidence_summary': { 'cached_history_analysis': { 'revision_entries_found': len(revision_entries), 'unique_dates_found': len(unique_dates), 'valid_dates': len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(pre_june_2023_dates), 'future_dates_found': len(future_dates) }, 'fresh_data_analysis': { 'access_successful': fresh_data_success if 'fresh_data_success' in locals() else False, 'unique_dates_found': len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0, 'pre_june_2023_dates': len(fresh_pre_june) if 'fresh_pre_june' in locals() else 0, 'future_dates_found': len(fresh_future) if 'fresh_future' in locals() else 0 } }, 'contradictory_evidence': contradictory_evidence, 'data_quality_concerns': data_quality_concerns, 'evidence_sources': evidence_sources } # Save final results final_results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'antidisestablishmentarianism_verification_final.json') with open(final_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"\n=== VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n") print(f"üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023") print(f"üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: {'‚úÖ ACCURATE' if june_2023_claim_accurate else '‚ùå CONTRADICTED'}") print(f"üîç CONFIDENCE LEVEL: {confidence_level.upper()}") if not june_2023_claim_accurate: print(f"\n‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND ({len(contradictory_evidence)} items):") for evidence in contradictory_evidence: print(f" - {evidence}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\nüö® CRITICAL DATA QUALITY ISSUES ({len(data_quality_concerns)} items):") print(f" Found impossible future dates from 2024-2025") print(f" This indicates TEST/SANDBOX content or data corruption") print(f" The page likely does NOT represent legitimate Wikipedia content") print(f" Examples of impossible dates:") for concern in data_quality_concerns[:5]: # Show first 5 print(f" - {concern}") if len(data_quality_concerns) > 5: print(f" ... and {len(data_quality_concerns) - 5} more") print(f"\nüìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS:") print(f" Cached revision entries: {len(revision_entries)}") print(f" Cached unique dates: {len(unique_dates)}") print(f" Valid dates (non-future): {len(valid_dates) if 'valid_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Fresh data dates: {len(fresh_unique_dates) if 'fresh_unique_dates' in locals() else 0}") print(f" Evidence sources: {', '.join(evidence_sources) if evidence_sources else 'None'}") print(f"\nüíæ Final results saved to: {os.path.basename(final_results_file)}") print(f"\n=== DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION ===\n") if june_2023_claim_accurate: print("‚úÖ CONCLUSION: The original claim appears to be ACCURATE.") print(" No evidence found of page revisions before June 2023.") else: print("‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED.") print(f" Found {len(contradictory_evidence)} pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.") print(f" Evidence comes from: {', '.join(evidence_sources)}") if data_quality_concerns: print(f"\nüö® CRITICAL FINDING: DATA INTEGRITY COMPROMISED") print(f" The presence of {len(data_quality_concerns)} impossible future dates (2024-2025)") print(f" strongly suggests this is NOT legitimate Wikipedia content.") print(f" This appears to be test/sandbox data or corrupted content.") print(f" \n RECOMMENDATION: The verification is INCONCLUSIVE due to data corruption.") print(f" Manual verification through official Wikipedia channels is required.") else: print(f"\n‚úÖ Data quality appears acceptable for drawing conclusions.") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis files saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")
Execution Output
Code Output: === FINAL VERIFICATION: USING SIMPLE LOOPS TO AVOID SCOPING ERRORS === Objective: Complete verification using explicit loops instead of generator expressions Using existing workspace directory: workspace_f3917a3d-1d17-4ee2-90c5-683b072218fe === ANALYZING HISTORY_PAGE_RAW.HTML WITH EXPLICIT LOOPS === Analyzing history file: history_page_raw.html File size: 220,232 bytes Extracting revision entries with systematic approach... Found 50 potential revision entries === DATE ANALYSIS === Total unique dates found: 68 First 10 dates: ['00:50, 23 May 2025', '00:50, 28 August 2024', '01:13, 29 May 2025', '01:15, 29 May 2025', '01:27, 22 April 2025', '01:36, 8 May 2025', '02:34, 29 August 2024', '02:41, 29 August 2024', '03:21, 20 January 2025', '04:02, 7 January 2025'] Last 10 dates: ['29 May 2025', '31 July 2024', '5 February 2025', '5 May 2025', '7 April 2025', '7 January 2025', '8 May 2025', '9 February 2025', '9 May 2025', '9 October 2024'] Analyzing each date for timeline classification... (showing first 20 of 68 dates) === DATE CLASSIFICATION RESULTS === Total dates analyzed: 68 Valid dates (not future): 20 Pre-June 2023 dates: 0 Future dates (data quality issues): 0 ‚úÖ No pre-June 2023 dates found in cached data === ACCESSING FRESH WIKIPEDIA DATA FOR VERIFICATION === Accessing fresh history page: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Antidisestablishmentarianism&action=history ‚úÖ Successfully accessed fresh history page Content length: 220,232 bytes Fresh data analysis: Total dates found: 46 Date range: 00:50, 23 May 2025 to 21:46, 5 February 2025 Pre-June 2023 dates: 1 Examples: ['2020-07-13'] Future dates: 0 === FINAL COMPREHENSIVE VERIFICATION RESULTS === ‚ùå Found 1 pre-June 2023 dates in fresh history === VERIFICATION ANALYSIS COMPLETE === üéØ ORIGINAL CLAIM: Page has no edit history before June 2023 üìä VERIFICATION RESULT: ‚ùå CONTRADICTED üîç CONFIDENCE LEVEL: HIGH ‚ùå CONTRADICTORY EVIDENCE FOUND (1 items): - Fresh history: 2020-07-13 üìà ANALYSIS STATISTICS: Cached revision entries: 50 Cached unique dates: 68 Valid dates (non-future): 20 Fresh data dates: 46 Evidence sources: fresh_history_data üíæ Final results saved to: antidisestablishmentarianism_verification_final.json === DEFINITIVE CONCLUSION === ‚ùå CONCLUSION: The original claim is CONTRADICTED. Found 1 pieces of evidence showing revisions before June 2023.
